reviews.text: This restaurant is the nearest thing to a pub in St. Anthony, we learned. I had a delicious steak and we passed a pleasant evening in the eclectic decor.
reviews.title: A very popular place

reviews.text: I was in St. Anthony for a week and stopped here my last day. Although I did not know it at the time, apparently this is a chain since I now see two other Jungle Jim's in St. John's.
reviews.title: Jungle Jim's - A good choice whil ein St. Anthony

reviews.text: Jungle Jim's is a pretty typical "sports bar" albeit smaller. A bar, booths and a few table all in a bamboo decor. Like all of St. Anthony, this is very casual so while the service was fine, don't expect what you might find in larger US or Canadian cities.
reviews.title: Had a great meal at Jungle Jims

reviews.text: I ordered a "Surf n Turf" dinner with steak, 4 shrimp, bacon wrapped mussels served with a baked potato and corn. The steak was very tasty and well prepared, better than the Haven Inn up the road. I was very pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Awful!
Surprised
reviews.text: If you are looking for a good meal, this is the place. It does not have local flavor or histor, but for good food you will be happy.
